SONETRouterTA

public SONETRouterTA(java.lang.String address)
Construct a new SONET router with a given address

Parameters:
address - the address of the new SONET router
Method Detail

receiveFrame

public abstract void receiveFrame(SONETFrame frame,
                                  int wavelength,
                                  OpticalNICTA nic)
This method processes a frame when it is received from any location (including being created on this router from the source method). It either drops the frame from the line, or forwards it around the ring

Specified by:
receiveFrame in interface IOpticalRouterTA
Parameters:
frame - the SONET frame to be processed
wavelength - the wavelength the frame was received on
nic - the NIC the frame was received on

sendRingFrame

public abstract void sendRingFrame(SONETFrame frame,
                                   int wavelength,
                                   OpticalNICTA nic)
Sends a frame out onto the ring that this SONET router is joined to

Parameters:
frame - the frame to be sent
wavelength - the wavelength to send the frame on
nic - the wavelength this frame originally came from (as we don't want to send it back to the sender)

source

public void source(SONETFrame frame,
                   int wavelength)
Sends a frame from this router on a given wavelength from a null interface. This is not a real SONET feature. We are using this to input frames into our network as we don't have any users creating data.

Parameters:
frame - the frame to be sent
wavelength - the wavelength to send the frame on

sink

public void sink(SONETFrame frame,
                 int wavelength)
Destroys a frame and prints an output with the frames details. SONET doesn't really do this, we use this feature to remove frames as we don't have anywhere to really send them

Parameters:
frame - the frame to be destroyed and printed
wavelength - the wavelength the frame was received on

addDropWavelength

public void addDropWavelength(int wavelength)
Adds a wavelength that will be dropped by this router instead of being forwarded on the ring

Parameters:
wavelength - the wavelength to be dropped

addNIC

public void addNIC(OpticalNICTA nic)
Adds a NIC to this router

Specified by:
addNIC in interface IOpticalRouterTA
Parameters:
nic - the nic to be added to the router

getAddress

public java.lang.String getAddress()
Gets the string address of this router

Specified by:
getAddress in interface IOpticalRouterTA
Returns:
the address of this router

addDestinationFrequency

public void addDestinationFrequency(java.lang.String destAddress,
                                    int wavelength)
Tells the router a wavelength that another router can be contacted on. Adding the routers own address and a wave length will let the router know that a wavelength is to be sent to the sink

Parameters:
destAddress - the destination address that the wavelength will go to
wavelength - the wavelength the destination can be contacted on

setDestinationFrequencies

public void setDestinationFrequencies(java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> destinationFrequencies)
Sets all of the destination frequencies at once, so that they don't have to be repeatedly created for every router

Parameters:
destinationFrequencies - the TreeMap of all of the destination frequencies
